website_summaries.verdict: An an excellent tool by an attentive company, it surpasses the competition with its adjustable head and sturdy design.
pros: Has a 63-inch handle and tines that adjust from 7 to 22 inches, which make it effective for a variety of raking tasks
cons: Some reports of faulty tine-expanding mechanisms, but the company offers reliable customer support and a satisfaction guarantee

website_summaries.verdict: If you're looking for a rake with a long handle, this popular model is sure to impress.
pros: The 63-inch long handle is much longer than typical rakes
The adjustable folding head expands from 7 to 22 inches to fit small spaces
Customers appreciate the lightweight design and excellent metal construction
cons: A few customers thought the head was too narrow even when it was fully expanded

customer_reviews.title: I guess there is a reason this design isn’t standard
customer_reviews.text: Works well, thanks to stiffer-than-normal tines, but if you try adjusting it a few times, you’re liable to have all the tines fall out. I guess welding them in place didn’t occur to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: ryesteve

customer_reviews.title: A STRONG RAKE
customer_reviews.text: The rake is great. It is most effective for me when I open it to about 12 inches. In that manner, I can grab leaves that are buried in the wet, spring sod. When the leaves are dry, I can open it all the way and move the piles of leaves around. The construction is strong and the handle is rigid so I can pull large quantities.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Freeman

customer_reviews.title: Very cool design but performance disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to like this Rake a lot but the rake is just too small! As in the the claws that rake the leafs. They just don’t pick up really anything. The handle and overall size of the rake is great. And the adjustment feature is pretty solid. But it’s the claws are too thin in diameter so whenever you rake anything it’s a fail. Sometimes leaves get punctured and get stuck on the rake. Cool design for sure. Just not good at rakin
customer_reviews.author: MAk5

customer_reviews.title: Most versatile rake, all metal construction, should last a lifetime
customer_reviews.text: Just received the rake and am very pleasantly surprised just how well made and versatile it will be. First, the feedback over the years about materials must have been heard by the manufacturer because it is entirely made of metal with the slight exceptions of the grip over the end of the metal pole, and the coating over the metal lever to adjust tine width. The slide mechanism is made completely of metal which apparently was not the case in earlier years. And at the current price point it is less expensive than less versatile rakes in big box stores.
customer_reviews.author: M. Urioste

customer_reviews.title: just perfect for getting in tight spaces as well as efficiently ...
customer_reviews.text: Not only is this a really neat tool, just perfect for getting in tight spaces as well as efficiently raking large areas, the seller is fantastic! I received a followup email from them that was informative and friendly within hours of the shipment. The rake is sturdy, well made, and comfortable to use. I have many trees that shed bushels of leaves in fall and rain seed things that grow into a virtual forest every spring. With this rake I will actually look forward to those two seasons and I have warm fuzzies from the company behind this product. Thank you for a most excellent buying experience.
customer_reviews.author: Karen DeCrane

customer_reviews.title: I bough it as a replacement for a similar and very loyal one which came apart after probably 20 yrs of great use. I was afraid that I would not ...
customer_reviews.text: With the weather improving, I finally used my new retractable leaf rake from Equinox Internat.. I bough it as a replacement for a similar and very loyal one which came apart after probably 20 yrs of great use. I was afraid that I would not find another. Well, after an afternoon of raking leaves even in very narrow spots, I am convinced that I found the worthy successor of the first one. It feels very solid and works very well (especially after spraying some silicone on the handle to make the adjustment to the rake even smoother). I expect to have this rake for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Solstice

customer_reviews.title: Nicely thought out product
customer_reviews.text: I've only used it once but it works as well as you'd expect a leaf rake to work. The adjustable tines are more useful than I expected. If the leaves are finer, you can bring them in closer together. The whole thing gets narrower then, of course, but it does a nice job on small leaves. The adjustment is also nice for storage. I have a very limited storage space and the rake hangs in front of some shelves. Being able to close it up means one less thing to snag on when your'e getting stuff off a shelf.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: *This is a JOY to use!*
customer_reviews.text: I was kind of skeptical when ordering this, because it sounded just too good to be true for the price - but my apprehensions were just wrong! In just a few seconds, I can completely collapse this for storage (or for use in tight corners!), while, conversely, it becomes a full sized (22 inch) STURDY rake with just one more flick of the handle! This is GREAT! This rake is very sturdy, and the adjustment mechanism is simple and easy enough for my young children to operate both safely and effectively: what more can you ask for? This gets my highest possible recommendation: 5 Soggy Piles of Leaves out of 5 Soggy Piles of Leaves!
customer_reviews.author: Labrat (Spero meliora)

customer_reviews.title: Threw it away
customer_reviews.text: After limited use the rake tines are bent in various directions. No longer adjustable and no longer useful as a rake.
customer_reviews.author: Dana from East Tennessee

customer_reviews.title: Not that fun to use
customer_reviews.text: This is fine for grass though I feel like it’s a bit tougher than it needs to be even on grass ( I try to use a very light hand for fear it’s messing up my lawn). But the reason for the three star is it’s absolutely annoying on any other surface. Forget about trying to take any leaves on the driveway/patio. It gives off this horrible screechy house and doesn’t work well. Prefer my heavy duty plastic rake.
customer_reviews.author: w/KiddosInManhattan

customer_reviews.title: Weak mechanism
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy. Cool idea but it's poorly made. The thing that's supposed to secure the rake it place works poorly, it twists around the handle during light use. Waste of money, get a real spring rake.
customer_reviews.author: B. Carver

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, great for chicken owners!
customer_reviews.text: I use this for mucking out our (rather large) chicken coop. The adjustable tines are great and go small enough to easily gather the manure/pine shavings, plus when I need it in the garden I can extend it out and gather leaves and weeds. The tines aren't easy to bend, but they do cave under pressure - I wouldn't use this fully extended with anything that needed a lot of force to move. if you do bend a tine, they bend back well with a little force or a pair of pliers. I really hate flimsy leaf rakes, and this is a wonderful compromise of weight and durability!
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Bingham

customer_reviews.title: Like and recommend
customer_reviews.text: I've only had it for about a week. I don't know how long it will last. I will change my rating if it breaks prematurely.I really like how the prongs expand and detract for lighter and heavier tasks. It is clearly helpful. However, the handle does not adjust. The rake is considerably better than my previous standard rake. The only thing I don't like is the plastic grip at the end of the handle. It scrapes my hand causing it to bleed slightly. I am considering covering it with duct tape or just wearing gloves. Despite this defect, I still highly recommend the rake.
customer_reviews.author: starratercustomer

customer_reviews.title: Great rake!
customer_reviews.text: I love this rake, the longer handle is great for my height and the adjustable tines make for easy raking in tight spaces, loading bins, or regular raking. Definitely not for ultra heavy jobs, as the tines would bend too much, but you can always bend them back if you get a little carried away. Love it, would buy 4 more so everyone can help with the leaves, exept I know they won't. :D
customer_reviews.author: Claire Christie

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised, so far - so good
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised with this purchase, it is lightweight yet not flimsy. The adjustment is fluid and easy to do - which is great for storage and multi-tasking jobs around the yard with one tool. The rounded tips on the tines is a nice touch. I've only used this tool a handful of times so far, but it's been all pros so far. The one caveat to this purchase is to remember that it's designed for light duty tasks.
customer_reviews.author: A. Lambert

customer_reviews.title: This rake is wonderful. It adjusts to whatever area you need to ...
customer_reviews.text: This rake is wonderful. It adjusts to whatever area you need to work in. I used it to get those last remaining leaves that had worked their way into the lawn. It got up the wet, limp leaves, as well as accomplishing some thatching of the dead grass. The handle is a littlel too smooth, as my grip slides a bit too much, but I still love this rake.
customer_reviews.author: StandsAlot

customer_reviews.title: Does what it claims to do.
customer_reviews.text: It's a pretty good rake. Not as tall as I was hoping for, but it's seems sturdy enough and does the job. Decent enough build quality, and very sturdy tines, but I feel like the first thing to go on it will be the adjustment mechanism. It slides into place and uses pressure to lock, instead of a sturdier pin locking system. I couldn't tell you how long it'll last, maybe forever, but my money is on that to break first rendering the whole rake useless. Non traditional handle means I can't put a taller handle on it. Works great for leaves, pine needles, and even minor lawn de-thatching.
customer_reviews.author: Bones McLure

customer_reviews.title: ok cheap rake.
customer_reviews.text: the rake works ok. the fingers start twisting sideways when fully extended out using the rake. its a ok rake to use for if you have limited space.
customer_reviews.author: todd johnston

customer_reviews.title: Tough, versatile, multi-purpose Adjustible Rake
customer_reviews.text: Multi-purpose rake. This rake does what the makers says it does, only better. The tines are strong, the ease of changing the width of the tines is so easy, it locks very tight. I was able to remove an embedded cardboard box that had small rocks inside, buried under a Manzanita tree, by racking the sandy soil with gravel until it all broke loose. If this rake could withstand that! It will surely do all need it to do. What a bargain too, I only need this one rake, not three or four.
customer_reviews.author: Becky F.

customer_reviews.title: Heavier than I am used to
customer_reviews.text: Received this a few days ago and have used it for a few projects. It is a strong metal rake, which is what I ordered, but it is much heavier that I expected. At 66 years old, it will be a good muscle building tool as well as a sturdy one-in-all rake for my garden. My grandchildren had fun adjusting the width of the tongs on the first day, but I can't seem to get them interested in ACTUALLY using it. ;-)
customer_reviews.author: C. Gray

customer_reviews.title: it exploded
customer_reviews.text: Third time I want to use it, all the tines just flew off. I tried putting the thing together again, no luck. Its not as sturdy as i would like
customer_reviews.author: John Windberg

customer_reviews.title: Great rake for yard work and fall clean up! Very durable and great design.
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought a rake at a local store which ended up snapping in half on me first day of use. I was very annoyed and starter looking online for something better quality. I came across this rake and even though it was more money I decided to give it a try. Boy was I pleased...it works amazing! You can extend the head and make it larger for bigger sweep or smaller for tough to get places. Used this rake for my fall clean up and very happy with purchase :)
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: Reviews don't justify this product
customer_reviews.text: I am very surprised to see the reviews of this product that are very high. For me, this product was much inferior to what I read. It couldn't hold the shape as the locking mechanism was very very poor. I had to discard it within a month after I bought it in 2016.
customer_reviews.author: R. Tilara

customer_reviews.title: I love these rakes
customer_reviews.text: I love these rakes! I have a landscaping business and this type of rake is definitely the most sturdy and adaptable rake out there. If you are 'hard' on your rake, make sure you get ones like these without the telescoping handles. That is a very weak point for the handle, which receives the most stress. Adjustable tines, though, allow you the option of raking light debris (dry leaves, and the like, with the widest setting) in open areas, or in tight spaces or heavier materials by closing the tines down to whatever width you need. Love the lime green handle coverings too!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Who needs an adjustable rake? I guess I did.
customer_reviews.text: I do not enjoy yard work. This rake did not change that, but it did help to make it easier. I was skeptical about the usefulness of having a adjustable rake, but it's actually a neat feature. Not only does it make the spread of the rake smaller, it also makes the rake stronger which I found quite helpful for certain areas of my yard. The company, Equinox International, also reached out to me via email to make sure I was satisfied with the product, which I found reassuring that the company would take the time to follow up. If you need a rake, buy this one.
customer_reviews.author: Keri B

customer_reviews.title: This rake performs perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I waited a while for my review because I owned a different rake from another manufacturer which didn't hold the position and became useless. This rake is FANTASTIC. I've rakes pine needs, leaves, little stones. I raked stuff off the lawn and off little stones. Easy to adjust and it keeps its position. I can highly recommend this rake. I was hesitant because of my other rake's experience but this one is a huge winner!!! I love it. It makes my clean-up job so much easier. - Update - after 2 seasons, the rake still performs perfectly and zero damage.
customer_reviews.author: Angie H.

customer_reviews.title: The tines are thin but well-made
customer_reviews.text: This adjustable garden leaf rake will work well on the big leafs that I have in my back yard. The tines are round, so some leaves may get loose, but it'll work for larger leaves. Also, I like the fact that I can adjust it. That's a cool feature not normally found in rakes. I gave it four stars and not five stars, because the tines are small in diameter, and some leaves may not be caught by the tines. I would recommend this rake to a friend or family member.
customer_reviews.author: JOSE A. DUARTE

customer_reviews.title: Tough & Versatile
customer_reviews.text: Love this rake! Had one similar many years ago which got lost in a move and couldn’t find one to replace it. It’s a tough & versatile beauty. Grabs everything without getting stuck and without much effort. My boyfriend changes it up for his reach and strength. I can use it for leaf gathering on my lawn as well as light soil raking around plants in my greenhouse. The BF has been eyeing it covetously!
customer_reviews.author: Audrey F.

customer_reviews.title: Is it possible to love a rake?  Yes, I believe it is.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this just for a long reach / narrow span rake to get to the roots of my shrubbery, which it does, very well. It's also a damn good rake in general, very sturdy, very easy to go from wide to narrow, and stiff enough to use as a "monster claw" to pick up a bunch of leaves at once for bagging. Buy one, definitely!! I'm getting a second one.
customer_reviews.author: Not Born Yesterday

customer_reviews.title: Great rake. It makes a bit of noise as ...
customer_reviews.text: Great rake. It makes a bit of noise as the steel tines have some small clearance to the adjustment mechanism, but I don't see a way around that. Best rake I've used, I'll be buying more for the kids for the holidays so they can help next year. Socks,underwear, and rakes for everyone... a magical holiday season indeed.
customer_reviews.author: attentiontodetail

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: This is not for rocks. Use it to clear the leaves and thatch. It works well especially around plants. You can make the head of the rake smaller to get in between plants. (It makes the tines of the rake closer). So far, so good. It was highly rated and I was tired of dealing with plastic junky tines that kept breaking. Feels like it’s really well made.
customer_reviews.author: Loves comfortable shoes

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for certain conditions
customer_reviews.text: We bought this rake and another one this past spring and luv them both. This one is great for pulling leaves off of flower beds or off of rock areas. If I was going to buy just one rake for all situations I wouldn't recommend this one - BUT, for tasks where you need a gentle touch then this rake is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Anne C.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect and easy to adjust, nice long handle.
customer_reviews.text: We have bushes and box-woods shrubs that I can narrow the fan for to get all the debris out of the beds. It also does great raking those in between spots. It is not a heavy duty rake but I don't need a heavy duty rake. I just need to rake it to mulch it with the mower. This adjustable width works perfect for my needs. I have some Xeriscape .areas that this works great on getting the leaves out. It wont move rocks but pulls those darn leaves.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher C

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love this rake with its expanding/contracting head. For storage it is great and for gardening sometimes you need a rake that has a smaller head with narrower gaps between the prongs. It's good looking and light weight. If it also lasts for a few years I will be ecstatic!
customer_reviews.author: Gen H.

customer_reviews.title: This is one the most useful garden rakes I have come across
customer_reviews.text: This is one the most useful garden rakes I have come across. The product is robustly made and I love the adjustable head that makes raking in and between plants and shrubs, very easy and effortless.
customer_reviews.author: Antosh

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Store
customer_reviews.text: Not much to say - it's a rake, right? Well, the fact that it's adjustable means 2 things: 1. You can open it all the way up for raking your yard, but still shrink it down for tight spaces around the edge of your house or between obstacles. 2. At its smallest size, it makes it considerably easier to store than non-adjustable rakes. Also, it is all metal and seems to be pretty sturdy. I'm impressed. The other reviewers were pretty adamant that this rake was definitely better than others. Color me convinced, because I'm a believer now.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Metzler

customer_reviews.title: Good Rake From a Good Company
customer_reviews.text: Item is inexpensively priced and well made with quality materials and excellent workmanship. Shipped promptly and arrived quickly. Company representative followed up to make sure we were satisfied. Highly recommend both the company and the product.
customer_reviews.author: AFPilcher

customer_reviews.title: Number ONE Rake
customer_reviews.text: I suck at writing reviews, but I could not let this one pass. This is the most Awesome take. I love it! The telescoping feature of the handle is like having several different rakes in on. It does an amazing job, and is lightweight, but sturdy. I can’t say enough positive things about it! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Cecily

customer_reviews.title: Strong and sturdy rake
customer_reviews.text: I love the Garden leaf rake. it's made very well. strong material and sturdy. i love that you can make it large for open areas and smaller for hard to reach places. i looks like it will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Geo Ram

customer_reviews.title: Good product!
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves this thing as it can be adjusted for a larger or smaller rake head. He bought it for a de thatcher, which it DOES NOT work for, but it serves its job well as a general rake. We’ll keep it since it’s such a good rake for leaves, debris, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Josh and Lexie Arrants

customer_reviews.title: Realistic expectations are key....
customer_reviews.text: I’m getting good use out of this rake. If you understand that you’re not going to be able to use the same amount of force and rake the same weight of stuff with a thin-tine, lightweight, folding aluminum rake that you could with a big, heavy steel one, you will probably be very happy with this feather light rake.
customer_reviews.author: BlueBellBlue

customer_reviews.title: My favorite kind of rake.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I was a little hesitant to buy this rake as it cost almost twice what I’ve paid at s local store. But my usual store was sold out and I needed a new one for my landscaping business. This one appears to be very sturdy and the lever to retract the rake seems to be a good design. As a professional ornamental gardener this is my favorite type of rake for fine work in and around plants, as well as, for leaf raking. The rake arrived quickly and in good condition.
customer_reviews.author: Karinlu

customer_reviews.title: Fast and convenient.
customer_reviews.text: I was able to rake up all the smallest items even those darn maple helicopters out of the grass and garden without disturbing my mulch or tear up my grass. Being able to quickly adjust the tines also made it stronger which was convenient.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: So versatile!
customer_reviews.text: This is great - I have right spaces in my yard, so having a rake that I can change the size on is perfect!! It's also sturdy and lightweight enough to do plenty of work workout getting tired. This really helped me clean up my yard and lots of bushy areas, much appreciated!!
customer_reviews.author: SH18750

customer_reviews.title: Great versatile rake!
customer_reviews.text: We're really happy with this rake. All the way expanded out, it works great for leaves and general raking. We've been using this with the tines closer together as a way to dethatch our lawn and pick up small sticks and trimmings from our trees. The rake is sturdy, and the handle is longer than other expandable rakes I've used in the past. Better deal and much better quality than the expandable rakes we saw at Home Depot.
customer_reviews.author: Brian R.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent rake
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised by this rake - it worked well, folded up nicely, and is lightweight. When I first saw it and given how light it was, I wasn’t sure it would work; but when I unfolded and started using it, I was so pleased that I plan on buying another.
customer_reviews.author: Sebastian Knight

customer_reviews.title: GREAT RAKE.  Don't try the knock-offs.  Not made as well..
customer_reviews.text: Just received it today and used it today! It works great. I had just left Lowes and I looked at their expandable rake but 1) i don't think it is made as well and 2) we (employee and I) were having a hard time locking the pole in place. It was $12. I think, though this rake is $15 more, it is worth the money. If anything changes, I will add to this post. But, I think it's a GREAT rake - after one use!! Really got into the tight areas.
customer_reviews.author: linda

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Rake!!
customer_reviews.text: I original bought this rake for my daughter and her husband. I asked her how they liked it and they said it was awesome. So I bought myself one, and I couldn't agree more. This rake is WONDERFUL. I love how it adjusts down to a small size to get into tighter areas. A great buy indeed. Thanks so much Equinox International
customer_reviews.author: CTNeens

customer_reviews.title: Good rake for tight places
customer_reviews.text: Bought this rake for my wife. She likes it. Nice for raking out between shrubs. It’s light duty though. When fully expanded it’s a bit weak. Don’t try to move heavy piles of leaves with it. We bought a second one.
customer_reviews.author: nestof3

customer_reviews.title: Best Rake Ever for Tight Spots!
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased a similar rake about 35 years ago at a specialty show and LOVED it. Used it so much and for so many yard projects, the adjustment handle eventually wore out - so I wired it in place with the rake about 1/3 of the way extended. This rake seems to be the same - I use it almost exclusively with the tins expanded about 1/3 - it easily goes into tight spaces to get leaves and twigs. Also, with the tines closer together - it is very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: SweetPea

customer_reviews.title: Great little rake
customer_reviews.text: Nice design, a tad flimsy to me in the mechanism , not sure how long it will last, but for now it works great, strong tines, would like to see a longer handle or even maybe an adjustable length handle?
customer_reviews.author: watts

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: came undamaged and on time. a breeze to extend and makes for easy storage when compact. haven't used yet but unless i run into problems, this rake will work perfectly for our needs. will update Update: 7/2016 I love this rake. I can adjust the width and functionality and have made this my go-to rake. Used it to grab weeds and debris under juniper bushes, small and large sticks, etc. My only complaint is that I'll release the lever and the rake will extend by accident. Maybe add another locking mechanism or change the location of it.
customer_reviews.author: NEO_shopper

customer_reviews.title: Useful Sizes
customer_reviews.text: Just moved to a home with yard & no tools. Ordered this rake as hoped one size fit all! It is perfect. Don't need different size rakes to get the job done. Tines are strong & gets into small places when needed yet opens to a full rake to finish up the job. Will recommend to relatives, friends & others.
customer_reviews.author: cmoose

customer_reviews.title: Tickled Pink
customer_reviews.text: When I opened the box and saw the shiny rake I said “Wow” ; when I held it in my hand and noticed the quality construction and materials I said “Wow” ; and again when I released the lock and moved the tine head back and forth I said “Wow” . Needless to say I’m tickled pink !
customer_reviews.author: Richard Ray

customer_reviews.title: Tine design even better now/
customer_reviews.text: Everyone who rakes the yard should have one. My second - wore the first one out. Tine design even better now/
customer_reviews.author: Red August

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for! Love the versatility of being able to adjust the size for hard to reach areas and the added strength made things so much easier. I highly recommend this amazing rake! You won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Terrence Coleman

customer_reviews.title: This rake is awesome. Just what I wanted and more.
customer_reviews.text: I got this take about a month ago and have used it several times already. It's great for getting into tight places under bushes or around flowers and for "fluffing" the mulch. I love the adjustable feature. I was actually looking for a small rake to replace a kid-size rake I'd used for years for those tight spaces. I saw this one and liked that it could do the job for both a small and large rake. The quality is really good. It changes sizes easily and works a whole lot better than plastic rakes. My husband, who is way pickier and skeptical about "new" products actually complimented the purchase!
customer_reviews.author: PeeWeeAnderson

customer_reviews.title: Great multipurpose rake
customer_reviews.text: Great light-duty rake for leaves, grass and mulch. It is well built and feels good in your hands. The all steel construction should hold up well when used for the stated purpose. A really great feature is the slide adjustment for the tines - a simple clamp style adjustment allows you to pull the tines in for storage, or adjust them all the way out if you want a wide springy rake, or part way if you need stiffer tines for things like thatching.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great rake!
customer_reviews.text: This rake works really well! Given that its a rake there isn't a whole lot to say beyond the fact that it gets the job done and doesn't feel cheap or poorly made when raking. It is a very sturdy, well designed rake. My favorite part is how it retracts for storage and also to get into some hard to reach areas - this definitely sets this rake apart from others. The only reason it gets 4 instead of 5 stars is simply because many leaves do get caught on the metal and they must be pulled off by hand. This isn't a big deal and I think most rakes have this issue just by the nature of their design.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Great adjustable leaf rake
customer_reviews.text: This leaf rake is just the size you want when you need that certain size to fit that tight or broad area at a flick of a finger. It is well constructed and with minimal care should last for years to come. The Equinox International Company is interested that you are satisfied with your purchase they give a 100 percent money back guarantee on your purchase. Also they include a professional lawn care guide for your home that answers a lot of how to questions for your lawn in different parts of the country. Great company to deal with.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Washburn

customer_reviews.title: like an umbrella
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes. I wonder what you people are thinking when you review this stuff. This arrived collapsed. Who wants a collapsed rake. The splines fan out, like an umbrella. They are about as thick and strong too. I have a garden shed for storage. I don't need a collapsing rake. I need one sturdy enough to rake leaves. This thing is a lightweight flimsy piece of crap. It won't rake many leaves. I need one of the old fashioned, green rakes with the wood stick. I bought this because of good reviews. WRONG. Don't buy this unless you want a toy rake for your child to play with.
customer_reviews.author: N.E.T.

customer_reviews.title: This rake is really nice for small garden jobs
customer_reviews.text: This rake is really nice for small garden jobs. The adjustable rake part makes it nice when raking large and small leaves. I also like to adjust it to a smaller width when I am going into the garden between shrubs. You can make it any size really, which makes is very versatile in any space. It is sturdy and doesn't feel cheap. It seems like it will hold up nicely with time. I will update my post in the future if I have any problems with durability. My only complaint is that I am 5'11" and it's not as long as I would have liked. But that is not a deal breaker for purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: MovingForward

customer_reviews.title: Best Rake
customer_reviews.text: My yard guy borrowed this rake and agreed with me. This baby is nice. The ability to spread it out as much as you want allows you to make it a perfect match for whatever refuse you are raking up. It has a nice feel to it. Firm metal. I love this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Perkins

customer_reviews.title: This is a great tool
customer_reviews.text: Instead of a blower I use this to clean my lawn, it is a great way to get a 45 min exercise. Moreover, this thing is more versatile than a blower because it will not blow away your soil, and the grinding action rejuvenates the top soil. Very sturdy and reliable. An essential tool for a good gardener.
customer_reviews.author: Anastasios V.

customer_reviews.title: Neat Rake but Not My Go To Rake
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, the rake is a little too short and has too few tines to be my go to rake but it does have a space in my garage and comes in handy when working in the landscape bed. I do not recommend it as a pure leaf rake.
customer_reviews.author: sunrain

customer_reviews.title: This looks like a better design
customer_reviews.text: Everything as expected. I had a rake of this design many years ago. The main shaft was aluminum, and eventually failed at one of the indents in the shaft. This looks like a better design, and the shaft appears to be steel.
customer_reviews.author: David B. Snow

customer_reviews.title: Adjustable rake, adjustable fun
customer_reviews.text: It's a rake, it sounds a little tinny and cheap, but it does work very well on leaves, wet or dry. A but harsh on the ears if used on a hard, concrete surface, but it gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: very short handle
customer_reviews.text: as a 6'3" man with the head spread it hits me in the navel. if you are short 5' or less buy it if you are 6 feet or better keep looking.
customer_reviews.author: Mike C

customer_reviews.title: Having lost my favorite rake lost in a forest fire
customer_reviews.text: Having lost my favorite rake lost in a forest fire, I am very happy to have been able to find a replacement. This rake is extremely versatile as the raking size is variable. Fully contracted, this rake is very easy to store. Baring any more fires, this extremely well-made rake should last for many, many years.
customer_reviews.author: Bitterroot

customer_reviews.title: A favorite garden tool!
customer_reviews.text: My husband has used one of these for years. The last one last about 20 years! It is so handy for raking leaves, etc. but also great for getting in-between shrubs, flowers, and other closely planted items when it is adjusted for narrower width. So happy to find a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Golf fan Di

customer_reviews.title: This is my favorite rake. I know
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite rake. I know, it's a rake, but I always hated rakes. Now that I can adjust to the size of the area so quickly (without having to go get a different rake, or drag a bunch of different rakes around the yard with me) I really do feel like I'm getting more done in less time, and it's sturdy, so that's a bonus. Good quality, looks great, no rust on it yet at all, and has lived up to my expectations. Will buy from them again.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda M

customer_reviews.title: This is the best rake you can ever have I will be ordering ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the best rake you can ever have I will be ordering more . Unlike plastic rakes that break easily you are able to rake even stones with this . We worked on the backyard for three days straight raking larger rocks into place, leaves, dirt just a great tool to work with . I only wish they had a grip on the stem because without gloves it's pretty hard to hold .
customer_reviews.author: Babus

customer_reviews.title: Adjustable rake
customer_reviews.text: The adjustable rake is quite sturdy. It adjusts easily from quite narrow to a wider spread of the tines. The handle is metal as well as the rake tines, making it stronger but not overly heavy. Raking between bushes and plants is much more efficient with this rake.
customer_reviews.author: Jael

customer_reviews.title: Very durable! Adjustable wired ends to fit any yard type!
customer_reviews.text: Works ten times better than my wooden rake! It's adjustable so you can get the fine leaves and rake through mulchy areas without taking half the ground with you. Had it about a month and done some vigorous yard work with it. Holding up well. Even the neighbors ordered one!
customer_reviews.author: Trisha

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic rake
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this rake through two Fall cleanup seasons so far and I couldn’t be happier. I like being able to adjust the fan spread depending on what I’m raking up. It’s very sturdy (thick handle), yet not to heavy, and the tines don’t bend when raking hard. And with the adjustable fan, storage is a breeze too.
customer_reviews.author: R. Smalley

customer_reviews.title: This is a pretty good rake
customer_reviews.text: . So, after giving it a workout around some old lilac bushes I can say that it seems to be pretty solidly built and being able to vary the size is quite handy. It has the feel of being an actual tool and not a cheap internet gizmo and I expect it to last at least a couple more seasons, so worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: S. Edwards

customer_reviews.title: The design and quality of the rake is excellent and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: The design and quality of the rake is excellent and easy to use. The prongs are sturdy and hold the leaves well. We have Pecan trees so adjusting the rake to the narrow settings allows me to rake the nuts up into piles making it easier to pick up later. Very happy with this product, would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Joey

customer_reviews.title: Great and easy to store!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased it based on the rating. I usually like the bigger plastic rakes, such as "Ames True Temper Greensweeper Poly Rake With 48-Inch Wood Handle 1920000" but decided to give this a try. It doesn't pull the grass or tree mulch, so it is great to use around tree beds. I have used it only once and so far it has been great. I will write more detailed review after I have had a chance to really test it out.
customer_reviews.author: d3n1x

customer_reviews.title: Nice rake for application versatility.
customer_reviews.text: The rakes actually a bit heavier than a standard type, but seems more stable. The adjustable prongs are nice for plant Rock beds and under bushes.
customer_reviews.author: Dstone.

customer_reviews.title: okay
customer_reviews.text: This rake is nice that it's lightweight and somewhat collapsable for easy storage but it's pretty flimsy. i miss a lot of stuff while raking and have to go over the lawn again to get everything.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Extremely happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this rake! I was able to transform our yard and a matter of minutes.... And I actually had a good time doing it! It’s great quality & easy to use, I feel like it will be around for many years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea L

customer_reviews.title: Adjustability is great!
customer_reviews.text: You know I really dislike raking in general, but this rake is great. We have a couple trees that have tiny leaves on them and because this rake adjusts I can get them on the first try rather than getting frustrating and just picking them all up by hand. Only used a couple times now, but I really like this product and the price was bad either.
customer_reviews.author: Ernie

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite New Garden Tool
customer_reviews.text: This rake is awesome. It is my favorite new tool for my garden. I don't have a leaf blower, so I hate trying to rake around shrubs and in tight places. This took care of all those issues!
customer_reviews.author: Sherri L Ouellette

customer_reviews.title: Solidly built and versatile. Great value.
customer_reviews.text: First, everything but the slider to adjust the width of the tines and the back handle are metal, and it's a solid gauge, not a flimsy thin aluminum. I like that the tines are stiff and hold together when you have small twigs in with the leaves instead of bending up like a plastic rake. Also with a more narrow setting you can slip in between bushes or flowers easily. Only con is that the rake become substantially shorter when set to a narrow setting, the shaft could be 6-12 inches longer but you may have a different opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Egray

customer_reviews.title: Works great, and becomes compact enough to store easily too.
customer_reviews.text: Much better than any plastic rake and the fact that with a pull on the lever it becomes a smaller width rake make it useful in areas where a wider rake will not work plus compact enough to store without taking up too much room.
customer_reviews.author: dr Frank

customer_reviews.title: Rake
customer_reviews.text: What a super rack. I got it to get into small area's and it adjust easily and very strong. The locking handle is easy to operate. A very good product.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Barnes

customer_reviews.title: This came very quickly!
customer_reviews.text: Rake is exactly as described. It came very fast. I love that the spread of the tines is adjustable, you can get into small spaces or spread it to get large areas, all with one rake.
customer_reviews.author: vikki clark

customer_reviews.title: Gets leaves and weeds in small areas, under shrubs and around plants
customer_reviews.text: I have several large gardens and do not use chemicals so hand weeding is hard on the back. Since I can make the rake head larger or smaller and it is made of metal, not plastic, I can use it to pull soft weeds out by the roots as well as get leaves and debris under shrubs and around plants. My back and knees thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Best rake ever!
customer_reviews.text: This rake works great for cleaning up pines needles, and willow leaves from crushed stone landscaping. Quick and easy adjustable spacing/width makes it adaptable to most needs. It's not super lightweight because the metal build is strong, sturdy, and designed well.
customer_reviews.author: bm

customer_reviews.title: Works, but adjusting it makes handle too short
customer_reviews.text: Love that it’s helpful raking acorns, dislike how short the handle gets when you adjust it to do just that. I suppose it f you’re 5’ or shorter it wouldn’t be a problem.
customer_reviews.author: JKY

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy gentle adjustable easily stored
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful rake for delicate flowerbeds and ornamental grasses. Adjustable width for reaching between plantings and for compact storage.
customer_reviews.author: Longleaf

customer_reviews.title: Good rake!
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t know what to think of an adjustable rake, but it works great. When you make the rake part more narrow, it also makes it sturdier for raking heavier stuff. Great idea!
customer_reviews.author: Bonny

customer_reviews.title: Delighted with this adjustable, sturdy rake!
customer_reviews.text: Delighted with this rake, and with the seller's thorough information and follow-through! The rake is very easily adjustable to fit any area, reaching places no other rake could handle. A shallow ditch that runs through my steep property to guide water runoff was filled with leaves, and this rake could be adjusted to the perfect width to easily clean that out! I love that it is compact when adjusted to its storage size, thereby taking up much less precious space than the average rake. Happy customer!
customer_reviews.author: River Mystic

customer_reviews.title: It raked up my heart.
customer_reviews.text: I just wanted a sturdy metal rack to do a little dethatching while I raked up leaves, and this was a good deal. Didn’t care about the adjuster when I bought it, but I now use it all the time. Also helps make it compact for easy storage. Sturdy, light and versatile.
customer_reviews.author: LawManMoon

customer_reviews.title: I love the adjust-ability so I can make it broad for ...
customer_reviews.text: I love the adjust-ability so I can make it broad for applications such as raking leaves, or I can make it more narrow for raking rocks out of dirt and the like. It's also much easier to store.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Functional but lightweight.
customer_reviews.text: The expandable feature on this rake is handy, though the tines themselves are very lightweight and less functional than I had hoped. No problem with rubber grip yet, as I had heard so many others say it was flimsy, but it’s still very new. I hope to be able to write a follow up after it’s been in use for a few seasons.
customer_reviews.author: Mary E.

customer_reviews.title: Not lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Compact and easy to use. A bit heavier than a plastic rake but that's what you want. The weight of the rake helps the pickup.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Besy rake I've ever owned!
customer_reviews.text: When I saw the ad for this rake, I had no idea it would be simply the best, most versatile rake I've ever used. I needed a rake with a wide head for big jobs but I also needed a small head to get into tight spaces. You get everything in one rake with this one. It's light weight but very sturdy at the same time. I plan to buy another one for my daughter-in-law.
customer_reviews.author: Guelda F Lambert

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had the chance to use this awesome rake!
customer_reviews.text: Seemed like an awesome rake! Took it out of the box, leaned it up against the building, came back from throwing the packaging away and it was stolen. I hope whoever took it, leaves it out in the rain so it gets a little rusty and then cuts themselves!
customer_reviews.author: KolombianNecktie

customer_reviews.title: Great for yard clean up
customer_reviews.text: Used this for spring clean up in the yard. The flexible width and strong tines worked well in clearing out leaves and small branches from between plants in the garden beds. I found it easy to adjust the width while working with a minimum of effort. Nice to be able to store it in it's most slender size for saving space. The lime green handle helps me find the rake in the yard if I set it down. A great buy.
customer_reviews.author: pc honey

product_meta.title: 63 Inch Adjustable Garden Leaf Rake - Expanding Metal Rake - Adjustable Folding Head from 7 Inch to 22 Inch. Ideal Camp Rake
product_meta.description: ADJUSTABLE STEEL Adjustable Head Expands From 7 Inches to 22 Inches 15 Flat Tine Expandable Head15 Flat Tine Expandable Head Adjust the rake width to a tiny 7 inchs for tight areas. This is designed to go in smaller areas that are difficult for conventional rakes. Expands to a full 22 inches. 3/4 Inch Zinc Plated Steel Handle The steel handle that is zinc coated to prevent rust. Light Weight Very light weight and easy to use, an ideal leaf rake. Note that it is not designed to be a heavy duty rake for rocks and heavy materials. Easy Storage Reduce the head when storing. Needs much less space than a conventional rake. 100% Customer Satisfaction Backed by the Gardenite 100% Customer Satisfaction .
feature_bullets: ✅ 63 Inches Long. Similar rakes on Amazon are only 48 inches long. The adjustable head expands From 7 Inches to 22 Inches

✅ 15 Flat Tine Expandable Head. Adjust the rake width to a tiny 7 inchs for tight areas. This rake is designed to go in smaller areas that are difficult for conventional rakes. Expands to a full 22 inches.
✅ 3/4 Inch Zinc Plated Steel Handle that is zinc coated to prevent rust.
✅ Very light weight and easy to use, the rake is an ideal leaf rake. Note that it is not designed to be a heavy duty rake for rocks and heavy materials.
